verses.verse: Oh that <WH5414> thou wert as my brother <WH251>, That sucked <WH3243> the breasts <WH7699> of my mother <WH517>! When I should find <WH4672> thee without <WH2351>, I would kiss <WH5401> thee <WH936>; Yea, and none would despise me.

I would lead <WH5090> thee <WH935>, and bring thee into my mother <WH517>'s house <WH1004>, Who would instruct <WH3925> me <WH8248>; I would cause thee to drink of spiced <WH7544> wine <WH3196>, Of the juice <WH6071> of my pomegranate <WH7416>.
His left hand <WH8040> should be under my head <WH7218>, And his right hand <WH3225> should embrace me <WH2263>.
I adjure <WH7650> you <WH1323>, O daughters of Jerusalem <WH3389>, That ye stir not up <WH5782>, nor awake <WH5782> my love <WH160>, Until he please <WH2654>.

Who is this that cometh up <WH5927> from the wilderness <WH4057>, Leaning <WH7514> upon her beloved <WH1730>? Under the apple-tree <WH8598> I awakened <WH5782> thee <WH517>: There thy mother was in travail <WH2254> with thee <WH3205>, There was she in travail that brought thee forth <WH2254>.

Set <WH7760> me as a seal <WH2368> upon thy heart <WH3820>, As a seal <WH2368> upon thine arm <WH2220>: For love <WH160> is strong <WH5794> as death <WH4194>; Jealousy <WH7068> is cruel <WH7186> as Sheol <WH7585>; The flashes <WH7565> thereof are flashes <WH7565> of fire <WH784>, A very flame of Jehovah <WH7957>.

Many <WH7227> waters <WH4325> cannot <WH3201> quench <WH3518> love <WH160>, Neither can floods <WH5104> drown <WH7857> it <WH376>: If a man would give <WH5414> all the substance <WH1952> of his house <WH1004> for love <WH160>, He would utterly <WH936> be contemned <WH936>.
We have a little <WH6996> sister <WH269>, And she hath no breasts <WH7699>: What shall we do <WH6213> for our sister <WH269> In the day <WH3117> when she shall be spoken for <WH1696>?
If she be a wall <WH2346>, We will build <WH1129> upon her a turret <WH2918> of silver <WH3701>: And if she be a door <WH1817>, We will inclose <WH6696> her with boards <WH3871> of cedar <WH730>.
I am a wall <WH2346>, and my breasts <WH7699> like the towers <WH4026> thereof Then was I in his eyes <WH5869> as one that found <WH4672> peace <WH7965>.

Solomon <WH8010> had a vineyard <WH3754> at Baal-hamon <WH1174>; He let out <WH5414> the vineyard <WH3754> unto keepers <WH5201>; Every one <WH376> for the fruit <WH6529> thereof was to bring <WH935> a thousand <WH505> pieces of silver <WH3701>.
My vineyard <WH3754>, which is mine <WH6440>, is before me <WH8010>: Thou, O Solomon, shalt have the thousand <WH505>, And those that keep <WH5201> the fruit <WH6529> thereof two hundred <WH3967>.
Thou that dwellest <WH3427> in the gardens <WH1588>, The companions <WH2270> hearken <WH7181> for thy voice <WH6963>: Cause me to hear it <WH8085>. of Solomon
Make haste <WH1272>, my beloved <WH1730>, And be thou like <WH1819> to a roe <WH6643> or to a young <WH6082> hart <WH354> Upon the mountains <WH2022> of spices <WH1314>.
